definition: to practice/to train/to drill/to perfect (one's skill)/exercise/(literary) white silk/to boil and scour raw silk

sentences.english: One book is available for each level of GFI.
sentences.chinese: 每個等級都配有一本練習冊。

sentences.english: He made a huge blot on his copybook.
sentences.chinese: 他在練習冊上弄了一個大的污漬。

sentences.english: Please don't forget to bring your workbook to school tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 請別忘了明天把你的練習冊帶到學校來。

sentences.english: There are five English exercise-books on the shelf.
sentences.chinese: 架子上有五本英語練習冊。

sentences.english: These math text books and work books are highly activity-based.
sentences.chinese: 這些數學課本和練習冊的工作是高度以活動爲基礎的。

sentences.english: Take out your exercises books please.
The Complete Musician, Second Edition including Student Workbook, Volume I.
sentences.chinese: 完全音樂家，第二版內含學生練習冊，第一卷。

sentences.english: As with other math programs, workbooks might be replaced from year to year.
sentences.chinese: 和其他數學課程一樣，練習冊也可以每年更換。

sentences.english: I use the activity workbook to set homework and review each section.
sentences.chinese: 我使用這本練習冊來佈置作業和複習學過的內容。

sentences.english: Complete worksheet handed out in class and pass in on day 11.
sentences.chinese: 完成課堂上發的練習冊在第11個教學日交。

sentences.english: Lucy likes to do exercises in exercise books.
sentences.chinese: 露西喜歡做練習冊上的練習。

sentences.english: Please do the Exercise One in your workbook.
sentences.chinese: 請在練習冊上做第一題。

definition: Six Records of a Floating Life, autobiographical novel and description of Qing dynasty life by 沈復|沈复[Shen3 Fu4], published 1808
lit. to gnaw a book/to study/to cram
to mention/to bring up (a subject)/with regard to/as for
to go around in circles/to make a detour/(fig.) to beat about the bush
to take advantage of one's position to bully people (idiom)/to kick people around
half a life/only half alive/barely alive/(scared, beaten etc) half to death
child bride/girl adopted into a family as future daughter-in-law
